Description: Marl pottery jar with flat base, two pie-crust handles on the shoulder and a short neck with everted roll rim.
Curator's comments: Published: A. Roveri and F. Tiradritte [eds.], Kemet: Alle Sorgenti del Tempo, Ravenna 1998, p.200 [156]. Illustrated in: A.J. Spencer, Pottery in Predynastic Egypt in I. Freestone and D. Gaimster, Pottery in the Making: World ceramic traditions. British Museum Press, London (1997), p. 48. Wavy handle ware W14 in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921).
